name: Herodotus
what_did:
Herodotus wrote about the wars between Greece and Persia.
He collected stories and facts by traveling and talking to people.
His book is called 'The Histories' — one of the first history books ever written.
why_matters:
Herodotus is called the 'Father of History'.
He helped people learn about past events by writing them down.
His stories taught others about different places and cultures.

questions.q: How did Herodotus learn about history?

options: He wrote the first science book
He started writing about real events

fun_fact: Herodotus wrote about flying snakes and giant ants — not all his stories were true!
